result.execSummary:
The defendant Eugene T Roatch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must report to Probation today 8/31/2016
**Probationary term corrected from 3 years to 1 year.**
Concurrent with: 16CF75

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court Office by payment plan of $25.00 per month commencing on January 1, 2017 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay will be civil judgment.

$6800.00 restitution on behalf of Brian C Swenson plus $680.00 surcharge on behalf of the District Attorney Office for a total of $7,480.00 joint and severle with Nicolas J. McPheeters (14CF396) to be paid to the Clerk of Court Office by payment plan of $50.00 per month commencing on October 1, 2016 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay will be civil judgment.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

No contact with Brian Swenson. No alcohol. No illegal substances or paraphernalia. No voting until civil rights are restored. If not a U.S. Citizen may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. Cannot hold elective office.
Must write and provide to the court an apology letter to Mr. Swenson within 10 days. Must be in compliance with drug program.

timeConds.notes:
To be used by Probation Agent if necessary.
Concurrent with: 16CF75
